intro: Rosa × dumetorum f. subglobosa, commonly known as the globe rose, is a compact, shrub-like plant with dense, rounded growth habit. It features small, fragrant flowers in shades of pink to red, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. The plant has dark green, glossy leaves and thorny stems, typical of many rose species. It is well-suited for container gardening or as a border plant due to its compact size. Its botanical name reflects its hybrid origin and the rounded form of its growth.
